programmes.show_description: ...Accident? The case of Cody Johnson, who was pushed to his death almost 200 feet into a ravine at Glacier National Park, by his wife of only eight days, Jordan Graham. S1, Ep7
Explore how General Deborah Green and her husband Jim created a sinister militaristic organisation. S1, Ep2
Can the sound of a suspect's voice reveal his lie? Can the moment of crime, buried deep in damaged video, be revealed? These are the high-tech tools of the forensics trade. S1, Ep4
Weapons are the hallmark of violent crime, tools designed to harm - or kill. Forensic science has developed a world of techniques for tracking and identifying these devices. S1, Ep5
Fire, water, earth - killers call on all the elements in their attempt to cover up their crimes. But even a body burned to ashes will still tell its forensic tale. S1, Ep6
A young man is accused of violence against his girlfriend; the court finds him guilty of disturbing the peace. S21, Ep226
A woman sues the father of her youngest son for the return of property; he claims she filed a restraining order and called DCS repeatedly. S21, Ep227
A partygoer testifies that a friend's parked car was slammed and thrown across the street by a passing vehicle. S21, Ep228
When asked about an assault with an ex-girlfriend, a man changes his story once evidence of alleged bruising is brought to light. S21, Ep229
A contractor with over 40 years in the industry, accuses a disgruntled customer of slamming him on social media; she says he didn't do his job. S21, Ep230
Innovative, value-for-money products brought directly to you at home. Shop 'til you drop whilst avoiding the hustle and bustle of the High Street.
A woman is accused of illegally using a professional photo of her grandchild to make a statement. S21, Ep196
An attempt to reign in a roommate's sloppiness ends in an assault, an arrest and a plea bargain. S21, Ep197
After a woman has a fight with her boyfriend, her cousin lets her move in; she accuses him of filing a false police report against her. S21, Ep198
A woman sues her mother for custody of a dog; her mom claims her daughter didn't care for the dog on a regular basis because she was in and out of jail. S21, Ep199
While a business owner is on vacation, his large four-wheeler is taken on a crabbing joyride and gets irreparably stuck in the mud. S24, Ep125
A woman says she caught her live-in lover half naked, drunk and on the phone with another woman; he denies all charges including giving her a bloody nose. S24, Ep126
A behavioural therapist passes himself off as an expert on trailer repair leaving an aspiring food truck owner with an unworkable estimate. S24, Ep127
A Tinder date leads to a business relationship between a motivational speaker and a photographer and ends with a defamation fight. S24, Ep128
A young man claims his aunt harassed him about his failing eyesight. He testifies against her when his girlfriend sues her for unpaid bills and moving costs. S18, Ep184
An alleged $100,000 lawsuit pay-out, oil field finances and household expenses come into play when ex-lovers fight over money. S18, Ep185
A woman describes shoving and slapping that took place during a heated fight. Emergency Golden Retriever surgery comes into play. S18, Ep186
Alleged death threats, restraining orders, and a pack of Chihuahuas come into play when family members sue each other for damages. S21, Ep231
A struggling, single mother takes out renters' insurance only weeks before a mysterious fire damages her rental property; she collects 12K. S21, Ep232
A woman is suing her former tenant for damaging her home when he allegedly installed a hydroponic system to make it a marijuana-growing house. S21, Ep233
A seven-year feud between two neighbours escalates and ends in court with incriminating video evidence of harassment and property damage. S21, Ep234
When a man misses a few car payments on a car he bought with his ex-girlfriend, she reports the vehicle as stolen; the Judge sets her straight. S21, Ep235
After a trip to Costa Rica, friends fight over unpaid travel expenses and unfair charges. S21, Ep236
A woman accuses the father of her child of skipping out on car payments because she filed for child support. S21, Ep237
When a child has scratches and a few too many bruises, a concerned father calls DCS on his son's mother; she says his claims were malicious. S24, Ep141
A woman claims her horse was neglected, beaten and malnourished while in the care of her former horse trainer. S24, Ep142
A man accuses his neighbour's horse of vandalism; she breaks down when he calls into question a Kickstarter for her cancer treatment. S24, Ep143
When a woman allegedly threatens her landlord in an angry rant, he files a TRO; she claims she was forced to live in a car while her children lived inside. S24, Ep144
In this gripping episode, we explore the tragic story of Sarah Williams, whose obsession with former fireman Ian Johnston leads to the murder of his new partner, Sadie Hartley. S1, Ep6
Peter Van Sant sits down for an exclusive interview with Melody Farris, a woman convicted of killing her husband on their Georgia farm. S37, Ep27
Janice Dodson took her husband Bruce on a hunting trip to celebrate their anniversary, only to find him shot to death in the Uncompahgre National Forest. S3, Ep2
Kylie Dembrey from Berkshire fell for Mark Sinclair, unaware his charm hid a violent abuser. She kept the years of abuse secret, until he tragically murdered her. S3, Ep5
Investigative genetic genealogy is used to resolve the 1988 murder of a mother killed in front of her toddler. S4, Ep11
Cutting-edge DNA science finally names the Phoenix Canal Killer who terrorised the city in the early 90s. S4, Ep12
Peter Van Sant sits down for an exclusive interview with Melody Farris, a woman convicted of killing her husband on their Georgia farm. S37, Ep27
Janice Dodson took her husband Bruce on a hunting trip to celebrate their anniversary, only to find him shot to death in the Uncompahgre National Forest. S3, Ep2
Kylie Dembrey from Berkshire fell for Mark Sinclair, unaware his charm hid a violent abuser. She kept the years of abuse secret, until he tragically murdered her. S3, Ep5
A young couple out walking along a pavement are hit by an out of control car, and a young mum calls 999 when her baby is unresponsive. S5, Ep1/20
A film extra is taken ill at the top of a cathedral tower and a Coastguard crew fight to save him. S5, Ep2/20
An adventurous pensioner is lost on Ben Nevis in a howling snow storm. S5, Ep3/20
A woman is trapped in her loft conversion bedroom while a fire rages below her. S5, Ep4/20
Put the pleasure back into shopping from the comfort of your home and choose from a selection of innovative products.
A man claims his ex-tenant damaged his rental unit, stole property and allegedly forged documents to try and prove otherwise. S21, Ep203
A young lawyer sues his former tenants for unpaid rent and damages to his home after complaints of strong pet odours by neighbours. S21, Ep204
After a dispute over rent, a woman posts a video referencing a personal story that her ex-roommate had shared with her. S21, Ep205
A salon owner for 19 years decides to start anew with fellow hair dressers; their partnership ends in a fight over allegedly stolen property and lost wages. S21, Ep206
A sneak peek at a phone allegedly leads to an assault, false arrest and a scar on a man's face. S24, Ep129
A woman's wild effort to pick-up her car lands her in jail for alleged assault and theft; she sues for a false arrest. S24, Ep130
A woman is convicted of assault after cutting her daughter with a knife during an altercation over puppies; video evidence captures the bloody aftermath. S24, Ep131
The Judge warns a grandmother about the risk of having a dangerous dog breed after her Pit Bull attacks a neighbour. S24, Ep132
The Judge calls a man out on his inconsistent testimony when he confesses that he sold the camper trailer he's being sued for. S18, Ep187
A mother being sued by her cousin denies owing for rent and resents being called 'not nice' by the judge. S18, Ep188
A $65,000 settlement, divorcees on disability, and back surgery come into play when a woman sues her ex-husband and her children for property and stress. S18, Ep189
A card collector must prove that a friend stole from his rare collection of battling cards; a police report surfaces that calls his testimony into question. S21, Ep238
A dog breeder in Georgia sues a man for selling her a dog with a genetic disorder; he countersues claiming he lost business because of her bad online reviews. S21, Ep239
A woman sues her former guardian for allegedly stealing from her little sister's bank account. S21, Ep240
A small business owner claims her marketing manager did not deliver what he promised; she accuses him of tampering with her negative online review. S21, Ep241
A man's access to car auctions gets him in trouble with an old friend when a car deal falls apart. S21, Ep242
A woman sues her son for unpaid rent and damages to a home she rented to him. S21, Ep243
Trailer park owners sue a former tenant for spreading alleged lies that bedbugs were running rampant on their property. S21, Ep244
A woman accuses her caregiver of running a pet sitting business on the side; the caregiver claims the senior committed extortion. S24, Ep145
A woman, her husband and her three children move in with her sister, live for free and then sue her for unpaid credit card charges. S24, Ep146
After two years of living on the streets, a man claims his new 'garage home' was upended with an allegedly false restraining order and illegal eviction. S24, Ep147
After meeting online, two women end up fighting over missing business property, a shared car and the 'gift' of an iPhone. S24, Ep148
In December 2013, the peaceful village of Bosham in West Sussex was rocked by the murder of Valerie Graves, a talented artist and grandmother. S1, Ep7
Erin Moriarty investigates the case of a college student, Catina Salarno, who was murdered by her high school sweetheart who lived across the street. S37, Ep28
The body of Cliff Carden is unexpectedly found in the Sequatchie River. Footprints and drag marks in the muck reveal that the man's death was intentional. S3, Ep3
In 2023, 14-year-old Nathaniel Shani was fatally stabbed in Manchester. SIO Gina Brennand finds his killers in the form of two boys, just teenagers themselves. S2, Ep8
